Art. 4.17. I
Inheritance rights of the surviving spouse
 Where the deceased leaves descendants, adopted children or descendants thereof, the surviving spouse receives the usufruct of the entire succession.
 Where the deceased leaves ascendants or close collaterals, the surviving spouse receives:
  1¡ full ownership of the share of the premature deceased in the joint estate and in the joint estate exclusively between the spouses, and
  2¡ usufruct of the other assets of the deceased's own patrimony.
  3¡ the usufruct of the property subject to the legal right of return referred to in Article 4.24 or Article 4.25, unless otherwise agreed in the deed of gift or in the will.
  ¤ 3 If the deceased leaves other heirs or no heirs, the surviving spouse receives full ownership of the entire estate.
